Appearance: Bottled 24/9-2014, cork and cage. Dark brown/red, lots and lots of light tan head.
Aroma: Berries, sour, wood/oak.
Taste: Quite sour, fruit and cherry. Vinous, also sweetness in there. Pearls before swine, unfortunately...
Bought: Trade with Gregory - thank you very much!, 375 ml
Info: 13/3-2015, 59/100

Pours a clear amber colour with a slight foamy red-brown head which recedes to a lacing. Aroma is cherries, raspberry and brett. Taste is red berries, tart redcurrants, red grapes which lead to a long red wine finish.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2015 Deep orange-brown pour, small off-white head. Great tart aroma of cherries, barnyard, brett and earth, apple, wood, smoke and leather. Flavor is fantastic, earthy, vinous, tart, with notes of wine and peach, cherry and smoke. Effervescent. 

Tart start, bubbly fresh middle, vinous finish. Fantastic.

Shows sour, wild yeast aromas, with a broad palate of orange rind and lemon peel citrus above super yeasty undertones, finishing with blasts of barnyard funk, sour cherry, and distinct loamy flavors. Shows style and persistence for sure.

Cheery wine nose raspberry type of flavor tons of hay and funk. Not a fruit beer fan but love the fruit sours for sure. This one is best with nice carbonation and so so good basement wine cellar notes of oak and barnwood. Superb.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 On tap at the brewery. Pours a deep mahogany, color, small white sticky head. Aroma is sour funk, raisins, dark sour cherries, pinot noir adds a nice element of dark fruits, and cherries. Flavor is very sweet and sour. Sour cherries, dark grapes, dark fruits, wow. Excellent. I tried this months ago before I liked sours and was underwhelmed. Now I think its amazing.
Another great beer from Russian River not their best but defeitnaly a good beer I still praise on these guys making beer they agreed great

A massive thanks to Guy for sharing this huge want with me. It really does live up to the hype it has. Nose is complex and juicy but the taste is where it takes it up a notch. Unbelievably zesty and juicy with plenty of cherries and plum. Loads of red berry tartiness with an amazing acidity throughout. Complexity at its highest with unfortunately huge drinkability. Goes down so easy. Amazing beer

on tap at Eulogy in Philadelphia; brown ale aged in Pinot Noir wine barrels and fermented with brettanomyces yeast; red color; sour fruit aroma with wine notes; fantastic sour fruit flavor; grapes with lots of wine notes and hints of oak

Bottle thanks to Pacha. Pours amber orange color with thin to medium head that lingers. Smell is brett, sour fruit, perfumy, Taste follows with barrel notes, sour cherry. Dry ending. This is beautiful.

Funk fest. Perfect wild sour ale, tart cherries tart funk and all so well balance, no had but great carbonation. Leaves you wanting way more. Nice sweet but dry finish, how they do that? Awesome example...or should I say perfect example.
Bottle shared. Pours a hazy amber with a thin layer of off white head. Taste and aroma of tart and fruit. So good.

Bottle shared with Dave for his 1 year anniversary. Dated 062212. Pours deep amber with a scant beige head. Aroma is caramel, tart cherry, acetic. Taste starts with sour cherry, oak, a touch of caramel comes in and it gets amazingly soft through the center. Finish is oak, some red wine. Really nice.

On tap at RR. Pours a deep darkish red brown, beige off white head. Aroma is oak, tannin, red grape, Brett, light lacto, minerals, earth. Flavor is smooth earthy malt, oak, dark sour fruits, dry lacto sour finish. Killer, especially on tap

Good lord, I get the fuss of this one now. Really is quite amazing. I hope Cali appreciates how good they have it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011 version. On tap at brouwers big wood. Typical supplication. Great beer. Aged a few years so is a little more sweet. Sour has mellowed a bit.

Served into a Teku from 010714 bottle of Supplication. As of now, bottle has aged ~ten months.

Aroma -- scents of inviting sour berries and wine barrels emanating from glass. Tough to pinpoint the cherries from the aromatic qualities; however, fruit esters are evident from aroma.

Appearance -- opaque, almost translucent, light brown hue. Little if any sediment in bottom of Teku.

Taste -- phenomenally balanced brew: the lacto and pedio coalesce marvelously w/ the pinot barrels. This brew has a dreamlike sour cherry tartness w/ crisp pinot barrel on the after-tone that leaves your mouth puckering and salivating for another sip. This brew is more sour than sweet, which I appreciate. The cherries in this batch are not as distinct or sweet as the Montmorency cherries--patented by New Glarus Brewing--but, still blend and taste brilliant, nonetheless. Fruit esters and brettanomyces masquerade ABV exceptionally well. 

Palate -- exploring all avenues of your palate, this sweet, sour, and crisp sour leaves your palate as satisfied as ever.

I have been aging this for ten months now. Supplication is a vinous sour that matures exceptionally well over time. Although delicious fresh, the sourness improves and may intensify over time w/o compromising the integrity of the beer. When I get a fresh batch, Ill reconfirm the aforementioned statement. I I am completely transfixed by the pure craftsmanship involved in the brewing of this batch.
user_location: The Garden of the Beer Gods, North Carolina, USA

text: on tap ambrata non molta schiuma acida ciliegia legno discreta acidita un po corta bel finale
This is one of the best overall beers Ive ever tasted. Great balance between ingredients, and the sour is not overpowering, but is tart enough on the palate to be very refreshing.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 Flaska från BottleRock LA. Bärnstensfärgad med lite vitt skum. Lätt syrlig doft. Smaken är torr och syrlig, kunde gärna haft mer sötma.
Sour aroma of grapes and lactic acid, amber colour not much of a head. Dry feel with a sour taste with hints of grapes and a sour finish.

On tap at Russian River. Pours a slight beige head fades with lacing. Brown color with aromas of grapes, raisins, lacto, wood. Taste like aroma with sour finish. very well balanced. medium body and carbonation. Not a big fan of the ageing in Pinot barrels.
Des cerises pointues dans un enrobage pinot élégant. Leffervescence est brillante et aiguise les saveurs, bonne minéralité et finale sèche, vineuse.

Batch 3 was toasty, a bit woody and with just a slight tartness. The fruit was starting to drop out. Batch 4 was fairly clean with the acid, and with balanced fruitiness. Seemed in its prime. Batch 5-2 was fresh, tart, fruity, and stil a little bit yeasty. Batch 5-5 was the weakest of the bunch, malty, not very lively at all. A dud, if you will. Of the 5, the Batch 4 and Batch 5-2 were my favourites.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of Pinot noir, sour Cherri's and apples. Tastes of sour cherries and grapes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at City Beer San Francisco. Dark orange color. Thin head. Medium to high sourness, low sweetness. Aroma is fruit, cheese, grape. Lovely balance!

These do not disappoint. Meaning, the RR sours. Sour esters with a hint of wood and grain. A golden brown color with hits of red. Nice foamy head. Full and dry palate. Big flavor of tart fruit, caramel grain and a funky sharp finish. Refined and complex.
Volunteered poured at GABF...wonderful wild ale funky sour and cherry sour both working together so well. I love the carbonation of theses brews from R.R. so champagne like. I loved it.
Bottle. From memory after having this off the shelf before BeerBro came online. Aroma of spring cherry, slightly spoiled milk, funk. Taste is very big cherry, sour, barnyard.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Russian River is always great. You have to like sour ales. Good color. Aroma of cherries gives nice start and finishes well.

375ml bottle. Vinous aroma with notes of cherry. Pours orangish-brown with a lot of carbonation and a thin white head and absolutely no lacing. Rich carbonation in the mouthfeel. Starts quite smooth actually with the sweetness of the cherries coming through nicely. Finishes very tart with the cherry flavor lingering as well as a vinous red wine character that lingers on the palate. Excellent sour.

Pours a vibrant copper color, hues of gold/pink. Small head, fine carbonation. Aromas of tart cherry, wet oak, cobweb, grape skin and light earthy notes. Taste is very tart upfront, acidic, vinous and loaded with oak. Notes of citrus, fresh cut flowers and an herbal accent make appearances. Lively carbonation keeps the tart present throughout. Finishes very crisp and dry. Excellent American Sour/Wild.

Red-pink color, medium head. Aromas of cherry, sour, crerry stone and wood. Flavours of cherry, sour, wood, cherry stone and wine. Couleur rouge-rose, moyen col de mousse. Arômes de cerise, sur, noyau de cerise et bois. Saveurs de cerise, surette, bois, noyau de cerise et vin.
Sour nose, amber appearance. Lighter than the consecration, but harsher aftertaste with some serious sour. Lip-pursing.
Wild fruit and barnyard....cherries and brown malt aroma with a very nice oak vinious balance. Very nicely carbonated with champgne like bubbles, a very special dry finish...A+++++
Pours reddish brown, beautiful. Smells sour cherries and red wine. Very tart with sharp cherry tones. Delicious

Bottle pour shared. Thanks T! Pours a reddish orange with a super sour cherry aroma from quite a distance. One of the most sour beers Ive come across. And Ive been looking. Sour cherries and berry. Wine like beer, but not a bad thing at all. Loved this beer to say the least.

Sample @ Quintessence 2014. Bière ambrée surette.  Nez fort acide, boisé accompagné dun houblon herbacé. En bouche la gorgé manque de générosité : plutôt douce et épicée accompagné de saveurs de levure boisée. Cependant elle offre un bel équilibre avec lacidité qui ne surpasse pas le maltage boisé et légèrement vineux. Finale surette. Bien

Pours yellow in color with little to no head. Aroma is sour cherries, lacto, and wine. The taste is lightly sour with a little bit of cherries and then the Pinot barrels come through in the finish. Very approachable for non-sour fans IMO. One of the best. Love it.
Bottle thanks to my landlord Frank. Poured hazy brown orange with mind head. acidic sour aroma with cherry honey. Med carb and bod. Brown sugar cherry funk sour taste.

Draught at West End Tavern. Hazy copper color, white head. Bitter/sour taste with citrus, cherries, yeast, earthy notes, ripe fruits, acidic notes and grapes. Bitter/sour finish with citrus, cherries, grapes and earthy notes. Magnificent sour/wild.

On draught during Baileys Taprooms Seventh Anniversary Barrel-Aged BeerFest. Dark golden amber color. Aroma is vinegar and basement funk, dark cherry, and Chardonnay. Taste is similar to aroma, but the flavors mesh better and have a woodsy element. Well-balanced sour.

On tap at Parry's. A reddish brown body with a thin white head. A small bit of lacing. Smells like a cherry sour. Tastes heavenly! One of the best sours I've ever had! Wonderful balance of fruit, Pinot noir and a bit of malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fad: Taster på brewpub. Rødlig gul uklar øl med fint skumhoved. Fantastisk sur duft hvor rødvinsfadlagringen tydeligt kan duftes. Dejlig sur og frisk smag hvor jeg glæder mig til at drikke de to flasker jeg har med hjem. Dejlig øl.
Slight sour aroma, dark cherries. Light red color with minimal head. Taste is sour with dark cherries. Finishes dry with a huge oak flavor. Delicious beer. Thanks Muthacack.

375 ml bottle at home. Dark copper color with nice off-white head. Aroma is mostly funky and "sour" at the beginning, cherry, bretty, a little bit vinous. When it gets warmer there are malty and wood senses. Taste is like aroma but more intense. Sour and funky at the beginning with tart cherries, later there are sweet malty notes. Great very long dry sour salty woody aftertaste. Medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation.

On tap at the RR brewpub in Santa Rosa: July 2014. 

A: deep orange-amber; clear; Large creamy bone-colored head is fairly furable and leaves some lacing. 

Aroma: about as good as this style gets (for me). 

Flavor: excellent very tart and fruity flaovr. Rather subtle effects from the pinot noir barrel aging, especially in terms of woodiness. Excellent lingering, midly tart aftertaste. 

FeeL; smooth; medium-light body; good low carbonation; near puckering tartness. 

O: excellent.
Old ratingbut remembering that this was perhaps the best balanced sour I ever had. Cherry, wine barrel, brett, earth, funk, lemon. Wonderful mouthfeel as well.
Bottle - Pours a murky brown. The nose is sour, vinegar, and cherries. The taste is tart and cherries up front and tails off at the end. Pretty good!!!

Bottle from Lectvay, thanks again! Copper pour with a small white head. Slightly acidic aromas of cherries and some wine notes. Oak and funk are also there. Flavor is an awesome combination of them all. The wine and cherry qualities compliment the oak and tannins so well. Perfect level of sourness. Just a very impressive beer. Its reputation is well-deserved.

Shared 12.68 oz./375 ml. bottle, poured to snifters displaying a hazed, amber/copper hue, with soft white head foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose was tart cherry, not necessarily wild, but under control, yeasty funk, woodiness, light tannic astringency, and mild vinous hints. The taste continued with a nicely balanced play on sweet & tart, and a pleasantly dry & fruity finish. Very nice! Thanks for donating to the cause, Bob S..

P: Dark amber/red and a one finger head that goes away in a flash. S: Dark cherries, oak, earthy, some orange peel, grapes and wine. T: Very nice oak, cherries, grapes, with light yogurt tartness in the end. M: Light and puckery. O: My first supplication in a long time, and did not disappoint.

Bottle. Hazy apple juice like appearance with a thin off white head. Aroma is vinous with tart cherry and musty funk. Taste follows pretty close. Excellent balance. Medium thick mouthfeel. Absolutely outstanding.

Bottle. Cherry, bitter, funky musty sour, tart, creamy finish, dark barrel, wine qualities. Lots of dark cherry. High carb with a sweet bite on the mouthfeel. Love this one!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This amber gold beer has an aroma of cherries and wine. It has a subtle sweetness but hits you really strongly sour. Almost champagne like. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very interesting beer. Pours a clear orange. Smells great, lots of wine, some green apples. Taste is extremely tart, but complex and tasty. Tastes like sweet tarts. Had in the bottle.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Wow, this beer lived up to the hype. Great tart aroma and the fruitiness is fantastic - great cherry and berry taste. Doesn?t look like anything, but what sour does? So well balanced and full bodied, really remarkable.

Bottle courtesy of Falco242. Thanks mike for sharing what I know is likely to be a favorite for you. Brett, cheries and apples in the nose. Dark brown. Tart on the drier side with layers accentuated by a long Brett finish. Gets better and better.
Bottle. Pours clear orange with white head. Aroma of cherries, lots of berry, sour. Tastes is sour with lots of fruitiness, berries, candy-like. Really good!

Meilleure sour que j'ai bu dans ma vie ! Au nez, on sent le baril de pinot, les cerises et les levures sauvages! Le goût est parfaitement balancé entre acidité, fruité et alcoolisé. La finale est enrobante, moyennement soutenue et acidulée. Je suis sous le choc!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours brown with a tiny bit of red tint with a thin tanish head. Aroma of cherries, barnyard funk, grass, saison yeast, apples, and tartness. Flavor is awesome, probably the best sour Ive ever had. Lots of cherry and tart flavor, a little sweetness but not overwhelming, funk, and no yeast bitterness on the back end. Medium body, dry smooth mouthfeel. Fantastic beer.

Another big time brew brought by someone to WWBA. pours ruby with nose of sour cherries and red wine vinegar. tastes of lovely cherries, vinous, barnyard, and wood. quite tart and maybe a little harsh on palate but very enjoyable
Bottle pour. Brown copper color. Cherries, apples on nose. Pinot. Mild field smells. Taste is tart berries, red wine. Round flavors. Sour finish

Bottle share. Batch 007. Pours a hazy burnt orange. Aroma of sour cherry, apple jolly rancher, red wine, grassy funk. Taste is so tart! Its exactly what you hope the taste to be. Delightfully tannic/astringent. Dry, crispy and clean finish.

Bouteille 375ml, gracieuseté de wilco. Thanks Mike! Couleur orange brûlé foncé translucide, mousse beige fugace laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre et une dentelle timide. Arôme vineux, cerise, boisé, brett. Goût vineux, cerise surette, grande acidité, cuir, brett qui sétendent en longueur, légère amertume. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-dense, huileuse.

Bottle at home. Pours amber with a creamy beige head. The aroma has dusty cellar notes with some ripe fruity and ripe berry notes. Cherry, almond and ripe berries in the flavor. The acid is subdued but balances this beer very well. Its great but Ive had better cherry lambics.

slight beige head fades with lacing. slight brown colour. aroma of grapes, raisins, lacto, wood. taste like aroma with sour finish. very well balanced. medium body and carbonation. very nice sour ale!  bottle @ cantillon quintenssence 14
Reddish orange pour. Nose is sweet and sour cherries, vomit. Taste is sweet and sour cherries, some wine barrel. Smooth body.
Well no doubt this is a sour but nowhere near the intensity (of course) but a reasonable interpretation of a Flemish. Sour citrus fruits are very broad albeit not deep nor long.
Had thanks to VanS in a trade. Aroma and taste is strong of apples. Similar tones to the breuerys sour in the rye. A great sour, very tasty.

375 ml bottle, bottled December 17, 2012. Pours a hazy translucent dark copper/light brown with hues of orange and red when backlit. Head settled quickly to a wisp with sugary white lacing. Aroma is tangy with cherry sweetness, but I also smell a a certain citrus complexity, notably grapefruit and oranges. Flavor is sour, mouthpuckering yet quenching. Sour cherries, a hint of brett, and a slight vanilla sweetness. Alcohol is completely masked - this tastes like a freshly squeezed cherry juice with a hint of cranberry, apricot and lemon. Dry snappy finish - world class.
Beige pour with a little cloudiness. Aromas of tart apples, Sauvignon Blanc and taste goes to sour apple juice, white wine tannins, and a hunt if ginger. Delicious.
Draft. Orange-brown color with a nice off-white head. Sour aroma. Rich sour flavor with bits of malt and oak with light lemon and peach. Dry finish.
Cherry nose. Slight cherry on the palate. Perfect amount of sourness for my taste.

Clear light hazy amber body with no head. Aroma has light wine character with tobacco notes, sour fruits. Taste has light fruity sourness supported with light wine sweetness. Body is full, light carbonation.

Bottle batch 04x5.
Poured in an Eku tulip glass. Pours a brown peach with small head and lace. Aroma of peaches, plums, green apples, cherries, whiskey barrel, horse blanket. Medium carbonation and significant mouthfeel. Flavors of green apples, peaches, sour cherries, red wine, lime zest. Overall very flavorful, complex, full-bodies although not malty sweet.

@ Quintessence - glowing orange-ruby red color, small froth head. Wild yeast, ripe cherries, orange zest, oak and hints of molasse. Cherries and wine define the opening, coated with orange and merlot grapes, backed up by zingy lemon zest and pleasantly smooth acidity. Dough malts feather the vinous fruits, while lingering tartness adds an intriguing, well balanced complexity. Bretts do not take over the taste of the beer, but accentuates the fruits, blended together with oak, malt and sublte sweetness. Lively carbonation, which gives this medium-bodied beer a fitting, velvet mouthfeel, resulting in a pleasant, sour aftertaste.
At quintessence. Clear amber colour with white lace. Caramel, fruity and brett aroma. Sweet, caramel, fruity and cherri taste, also sour. Medium to full body.

This was a 2012 bottle, its evolved nicely over fresher ones Ive had. Always one of my favorite sours. Dank fruit, funk, sour, barrel, lacto... all there and then some. I would drink it all the time if it were regularly available.
Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours light brown/amber with white head. Aroma is a bit sour, fruity. Taste little sour, fruity, subtle coffee hints.
2014.04 - Cantillon Quintessence 2014 - verrassend lekker - bier met eigen karakter

Notes from 4/5/2014

Appearance - 5/5 - orange-red color, hazy, white head leaves great lacing
Aroma - 9/10 - tart, sour lemon, a little bit if vinegar and funkiness
Taste - 9/10 - sour, cherries, lemon juice, vinegar, funky, barnyard tastes, grass, bread
Palate - 5/5 - light but sour and funky, alc covered, aftertaste is lemon juice. def a sipper.
Overall - 19/20 - a little overhyped. Nothing like anything else Ive tried though. A true unique beer.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2014 Pours amber with a thin white head. Tart, fruit and malt aroma. Tart, rich fruit, malt, oak and wine flavors. Medium light body and a fruity tart finish.

375ml bottle thanks to bytemesis! Pours hazy ruby red brown with small half finger pink head. Nose is musty tart funk, dark cherries, molasses, berries, grape, red wine. Taste is crisp tart funky dark berries, cherries, wet earthy wood, basement, touch of bread, wine. Carbonation level is perfect. Finish is balanced sour cherry, blackberry, strawberry, red grapes, dusty wood, occasional touches of sweetness. Spectacular, a true classic.

Bottled 1/7/14 
Pours a nice brownish red color. Big aroma of cherries and red wine as well. Taste is very sour but not harsh in any way. Cherry taste and wine sweetness as well. Delicious sour and one of the best ones out there

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This one has a very fruity taste. The impact was probably softened by the sour ale I tried just before it, but it has that sour kick nonetheless.

Brown bottle, 375 ml, bottled on 102113, purchased at Belmont Station, savoured on April 11 2014; eye: auburn with a reddish hue, clear, average effervescence, tiny ring of khaki head, no lacing; nose: sourness, woody, light fruity, wild yeasts, slight tannin, alight cherry; mouth: sourness, woody, acidity, light fruity, wild yeasts, slight tannin, light horse, light cherry, acidity, sour finale with presence of musk, medium-full body, rather carbonated, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS
	
Bouteille brune, 375 ml, 7,75 %, embouteillée le 102113, achetée chez Belmont Station, savourée le 11 avril 2014; il : châtain avec une teinte rougeâtre, limpide, effervescence moyenne, petit anneau de mousse kaki, pas de dentelle; nez : aigreur, boisé, léger fruité, levures sauvages, très léger tanin, très léger cerise; bouche : aigreur, boisé, léger fruité, levures sauvages, très léger tanin, léger cheval, léger cerise, finale aigre avec présence de musc, corps moyen-corsé, plutôt carbonatée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Pours reddish brown with minimal head. Nose is sour cherries, brett, red winey, sour apple. Taste matches nose, cherry, grape skin, vinous note, sour apple rather tart all the way through with the lactic acid sourness and some funk, but not much. Does not dry out a ton at the end, is dry on the whole, but I get the oak barrel character on the finish. It's really good, but I do slightly prefer consecration.
Reddish brown with no head to speak of. Nice sour character of cherries and wine. Tart and sweet finish. This is a good one.

April 2013 bottle from some kind soul that I dont recall. Pours a nice deep reddish pink, slight white head. Tart, fruity aroma. Grape, cherry, apple, cinnamon, wood. Taste is sweet, tart, slightly puckering, cherry, blueberry, apple, cinnamon, blackberry. Really lingers on the tongue. Imminently chuggable.

Unreal deliciousness. Pours a orangish clear with small dissipating white head. Sour cherry earth smell. Beautiful sour yet sweet taste. Amazingly well carbonated. Sincerely great. Bottle - Received in Trade

First sour Ive ever had (not that I hadnt read about them for several months now). Got it and a few others from RR as a gift (and later found out the price- yikes!). Mine was from bottle, batch 007. I finally decided Id crack it open. Smell from the bottle smelled more like a wine that an ale. Strong smell of oak, cherries and musty goodness - little bit like the Pirates of the Caribbean ride. Knowing it was a sour ale, but not knowing what to expect, the first taste hit my tastebuds and made them all go running with excitement. Its not a "beer" and its definitely not a wine. If I classified it, it wouldnt be an ale either - I guess thats why they call it a sour (ale). Tart initial taste, followed by just enough carbonation and a crisp finish (along with some flavors/layers I cant do justice to). I dig it - I couldnt drink a bunch of these, but it was worth the wait (and the cost - thanks to my brother-in-law John)!
Tart, cherry, cranberry, bretty-funk. All present but all integrated seamlessly together with just enough sweetness to keep it balanced. Finishes crisp. Delicious. I just wanted to more and more!

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Rate #1100! Bottle from the brewpub itself. Pours a dark red color, somewhat opaque, with a one finger off white head on top. Aroma of sour cherries, vinegar, vinous grape notes. Very nice. Flavor is a medley of sour cherries and vinegar first, but with some beautiful oak and vinous notes that give this a huge punch of flavor and depth. Lots of bretty funk and big lacto bite. The wine notes continue to emerge as it warms. Some nice sweetness that balances out the sour beautifully. Full bodied for a sour brew, with lots of carbonation. A top rated beer for good reason.

Aromaa intensos, agradables y acordes al estilo. Notas acidas y frutales. Se distinguen ciertas notas citricas, cerezas, algo de vainilla y maderas.

En cuanto a su apariencia, colorcobrizo claro, carbonatacion de media a alta, cuerpo redondo y cabeza de espuma baja de mediana retencion.

En boca acidez inicial, buen equilibrio, final frutal.

Al paladar es una cerveza fresca y agradable, sin embargo y cómo lo indica el estilo, acida, sobre todo en un principio, posteriormente se equilibra con ciertas notas dulces proporcionadas por los esteres frutales y por las cerezas añadidas. 

En resumen es una excelente cerveza del estilo, notas acidas pero sumamente bien equilibrada, terminando en sabores frutales bastante elegantes y bien definidos.
Bottle at Monks. Had several times in past. Poured deep ruby with fizzy head. Flavor of tart cherries, plums, oak. Medium bodied. Phenomenal sour.
Pours dark ruby with thick head. Smell is funky, yeasty, fruit and cherries. Taste is dry notes of yeast, sour cherry and fruit. Light body and light carbonation.

Poured from bottle to glass. Amber hue with fizzy white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is fruit, acid, Brett, vinegar, apples. Mouthfeel is great with light body and high carbonation. Taste is dry tartness with sour following and CO2 sharpness in the finish. Overall this is a really nice brew.
2012 vintage on tap at Whole Foods. Pours a pale clear brown color without much head. Nice medium sourness that isn't at all harsh. Mild cherry.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a clear light amber golden color with an off white head. Aroma is quite tart with hints of cherry and wine. Flavor is also very tart. Cherries a bit more present in the taste. Light sour lingers into the finish. Delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2014 Red brown. Aroma is vinegar, malt - looks and smells like a classic flanders red. Lovely so far. Taste is perfect sour level - outstanding straight up sour ive had. Malt is so well balanced and barrel aging adds but not overpowering. Overall, a classic beer.

Corked and caged 375 ml bottle from pushkinwow. Pours hazy brown/amber with a small beige head. Aroma is vinegar, red berries, sour apples and some vanilla. Taste is nicely balanced and not overly tart. I get cherries, raspberries, green apples, vanilla with some oaky flavours to it. Very nice and balanced beer!

Bottle shared by bruce. Aroma is oak, cherries, and slight vinegar. Pours dull red with a big fizzy head and some red chunks of cherry. Taste is light and slightly funky with fresh cherry, sour wine, strong oak, and red grape. Very subtle but full bodied. Complex and wonderful.

Bottle pour is a murky copper with a blush of pink and a yellow-tinted thin head. Aroma is cherries and grape with a lot of sour. Taste is acidic with cherries and hints of grape. Lots of carbonation. Tart acidic finish. Big attention-getting flavor. Great sour.

Wee bottle thx to adnielsen - this years birthday beer cons 2014-02-10 Gbg
batch 008 AR: kriek, tart, Cava, cherry seeds, 
AP: brandy, reddish, no head/when I forced it high fizzy wee bubble beige head
F: fine subtile cherry flavour, wee brandy, tart, cherry seeds, rich in carbonation, medium citrus bitternes, full lasting body, finishes rart cherries ... Many thx Aaron again for this gem.

Huge thanks to VanS for the bottle! Pours copper with light tan head. Aroma is sour cherry, grapes, and red wine. Taste is all sour, with great cherry and red wine flavors. A dry finish and long after taste that sits in your mouth for a long while. Terrific sour ale.

Part of a special "barrel" week at The Beer Junction. $4 for a 4oz pour, 7% ABV. Rich, red-copper color. Tremendous lace sticking to the glass. Aroma was a bit sour and unfortunately, I think I was picking up hints of the sanitation in the glass. Flavor had a mild puckering tang, no hop bitterness and not too sweet. Carbonation was average and viscosity was above average. Delicious aftertaste. This was worth the price for a special treat.

Bottle once again due to jonnyguns being a gentleman. Pours murky dark ruby with a khaki head. Immediate aroma of sour cherries and grapes, musky dark fruits, lemons, molasses and burnt caramel. Wow, what a nose. Flavours are upfront sweet and sour - lots of vinous flavours mixed with sour tartness. Almost has a Belgian style malt character - molasses again, dark caramel and fruits. Dry finish leaves you so thirsty for more. Fucking good beer.
Tasted a couple times thanks to good friends. This beer is great. Wish it was more readily available to me.
Wild ales have become the craze, but nothing can take away from the sour goodness this beer provides. Layers of cherries and lactase accompanied by mouthwatering acidity. Top notch!

Bottle (10/21/13 batch) poured into a snifter. Pours a dark copper/amber color with a finger off-white head. Aromas of grapes, cherries, dark fruit, red wine, tart and sour fruits, vinegar. On the taste, big acidity and vinegar with grapes, cherries, red wine, Brett, funk, a bit of oak. Dry finish, medium body.

Did a vertical with the 12/17/12 batch. Less head on the 12, a bit under a finger off-white head, and seemed to fade quicker. Faded aroma, a bit of an off-smell I cant quite determine. Taste is still pretty acidic and vinegary, maybe a bit more tart and oaky with bigger cherries.

Bottle. Lovely amber with a blush of pinkish-orange. Aroma is yoghurty-sour, with cherries and oak. Lovely fresh sour cherries and lactic tartness, woody and vinous traits throughout. Very drinkable, fresh and lively. So good!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft at Fire on the Mountain, Denver. Cloudy lightly reddish mahogany. Nose of tart cherry, red wine, lactic funk, wet wood. Taste follows with great cherry and red wine character and fruitiness lending a perception of sweetness nicely balanced by the actual lactic bite. Benchmark standard bearer cherry sour.

Quite a few bottles at various times. Pours a light mahogany/brickish red color with minimal head. Nice nose of wine barrel, wet wood, sour cherry, Carneros/Russian River Valley Pinot spice, and acid. Dry, vinous palate that tastes of dried cherry, light leather, funky Brett, and a nice tartness. This, along with Rodenbach GC & Cantillon Classic are what hooked me on sours.

Bottle at La Trappe, SF. Pours hazy brown with lacing. Aroma is sour and tart, with slight toffee and bread notes. Taste is very tart, with cherries and a looooong-lasting finish. Smooth mouthfeel with nice carbonation. Good!

Sample at First Sunday. Hazy orange pour, with a thin, beige head and lots of particulates. Intense aromas of mandarin oranges and caramel, with some notes of cinnamon, black cherries, and lemon zest. Very balanced sour and sweet flavors, with just a little spiciness. Medium body, acidic, and fairly effervescent. This is a wonderful sour ale. Very balanced, complex but consistent, sour but easy to drink, and generally just delicious.

Bottle from City Beer, SF. Pours a reddish copper with an off white head that holds up ok. Lacing is clinging to the glass nicely. Aroma is fucking sensational. Lots of tart cherries, Pinot, oak, funk and hints of brown sugar. Taste is where this one just explodes on to the palate. Mouth is coated with upfront sour cherry and brown sugar. Very tart lingering bitterness that coats your mouth for a while. Fucking unreal stuff. Dry tart bitterness that leaves you wanting more. Drink this slowly, savior every sip. One of the best beers I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Red amber colour, some white foam. Low carbonation. Medium body with complex sour notes. Vinous and fruity, sour cherry. Very drinkable. Dry and bitter finish. Good but very overrated.

Amber in color, little to no head. Aroma of apples, cherries, vanilla and brown sugar. Sweet upfront with cherries and then major sweet tarts. Very sour. Light body, lots of carbonation and dry finish.

375ml bottle shared with myself on new years eve. Labeled 121712. Deep reddish brown pour with minimal white head. Smell is waterlogged wood, cherries, basement funk, slight apple cider. Taste is sour cherry, oak, apple, wine grapes. Sharp tartness up front, very pleasing and smooth finish. Wonderful fantastic.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy amber color with a thin head and minimal lacing. Sour cherries and hints of grapes and sugar. You can definitely smell the sourness but its not overpowering. Fruity sourness all around with a sweetart aftertaste. Coats your palate and lingers a bit afterwards but very pleasing. Delish.

Everything was excellent going on here Lacto, Lambic Brett, Basement and Barnwood Pear pencil Cherry raspberry fruitiness all balancing the aroma the body the flavor and in the end finish! excellent beer

October 2013 bottle shared thanks to Tim and Rachel! Pours a cloudy golden orange with nice ring of off-white lacy head. Aroma of lactic sourness, cherries and musky wood, acetic middle, and a sweet fruity ending. Taste follows, with a nice tartness that lasts forever. Awesome, nice soft carbonation, amazing stuff.

Rating based on most current review:

13DEC11 review:
Batch 005x4 - Brewed 2009, bottled May 2010
A: A lovely amber ale pours from the bottle and falls under a finger of taupe foam of fine nature. The foam settles into a solid, thick sheet of the same. Sandy, spotty lace. Excellent clarity. Looks both rustic and inviting. (4.5)
S: What jumps out at me immediately is how much this smells like a Flanders Red now, oak and cherry hues over an apple cider vinegar intonation. Theres a tannic characteristic in the nose as well. Theres a slight grassy funk which is woven into the tart and woody characteristics quite well. Although there is much going on here, I find the nose a little too delicate. (4)
T: Tart with cherries so dominant. I am very, very surprised on how pronounced the cherry is here. It is followed through with oak, dry grapes, and interesting canned spinach flavor. Im noting an umami/leather flavor as well. Complex, intriguing. Theres a bitter undertone that is just bitter enough to impress me to reserve appreciation for the other flavors, but just as I start to get annoyed, it seems fleeting, and I almost seek out the bitterness to help clean the medium of my tongue. The tart aspect of the beer is inhibited by this bitterness in so much as it accentuates the character and marries the other nuances of the beer together. Seriously, this is really, really well blended beer. Impressive. (4.5)
M: Medium bodied and lively foam conspire to a really velvety feel and as this roams my mouth, I think it will dry it out. Upon swallowing and exhaling, my mouth is simply wet and the notes are warmed via alcohol and blossom back through the mouth. Really nice feel here. Im hard pressed to think of what I would change here, cant think of a thing, a hard earned 5 here. (5)
O: I am struggling to think of another beer in this particular style I prefer to this one. I am calling this a Flanders Style, and I am only considering one other in the realm that competes for me: Dissident. And only time will tell if the 11 batch will meet expectations. I really enjoy this beer. And although Im not likely to go out of my way to find it as much, I would likely grab some next time I see it on the shelves. (4)

25JAN11 review:
Batch 005x3 - 09, bottled May 2010
A: Beautiful blood orange color. Light and sandy lemon foam atop ale - two fingers which last for-ev-er. (4.5)
S: The smell of this burst out the bottle as the cork came out. Sour apple, cherry, farm funk, and grain all balance so beautifully I struggle to understand the process of developing this type of complexity in a beer. Goddamn gorgeous. (5)
T: So sour. Deliciously sour. So much going on here, Im not going to waste time trying to articulate. (5)
M: Lovely carb tone with great latitude when gliding over the palate and I get to savor every. last. drop. (4.5)
D: Dont ever NOT drink this beer. (5)

Serving type: bottle

12-14-2011

Bottle. Pours a clear, blood orange color with little to no head. Thick, cherry aroma with some oak notes. Slight, sour taste with a nice hint of cherries. Smooth finish. Amazing sour from Russian River.

Reddish amber hue with small white head. Tart cherry and funk on the nose. Unbelievable balance between brett funk, lacto tartness, bright pinot noir, and light sweetness and acidity from the sour cherries. I always tell people this is my favorite beer in the world, and every time I drink it Im convinced its true.
This is a phenomenal sour. Deep red cherry ale. Lots of oak, hints of vanilla, horse blanket, oak.

Bottle at home.
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: sour, cherries, wood, red wine, dried fruits, little hoppy.
TASTE: sour, cherries, wood, red wine, oak!

Bottled 10/21/13 Supplication is a sublime manifestation of the style. A true palate bender which does its work quickly and becomes very accessible by the third sip, this amazingly complex beer is rather unique. The balance of flavors makes room for contributions from all quarters. There is a bit more funk than Ive experienced in sours of this quality. The beer evolves in the glass.

Bottle: hazy, amber brown with a red hue. Low to moderate white head. Massive bretty nose. Dominant barnyard and funk. Very wild. Just a hint of sour cherry. Could easily be a bretty red wine. Dry, sour and bitter. Long, question balance. Loads of flavor thats all off because thats the stilly. Mid weight , long and tight. Like liking a horse. 
Classic but Im not convinced this is what the style is about. Totally over the top like the rest of the beer from this house. Hard to see the cherry.

Serving: 375 ml. bottle from bytemesis. Thanks Mike! Pours a nice copper color with a thin white ring. Huge bretty nose with lots of tart cherry and oak notes. Obviously sour up front with nice, bright fruit notes, light oak, and a light sweetness after the sourness subsides. Light to medium body with just enough carbonation. Absolutely delicious.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 A game changer in many ways. Superlatively balanced; big brett, oak and wine notes in the nose, pours amber with about an inch and a half of head. Very tart, with the malts creeping on the back and an amazing sweet middle of the mouth warming up to more oak. A masterpiece of brewing, and a new standard for the style even (superior to the Lost Abbey products).
Tap at Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries and sourness.

Perhaps the best beer I have ever tasted. Certainly the most expensive.
Love the pinot noir barrel tones.

On tap at the brewery poured into a tulip. Perhaps the most perfect sour I've ever tasted - tart and crisp with light malty undertones. Amazing nose and beautiful on the eyes. Absolutely lived up to its reputation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Baileys Taproom, Portland, Sixth Anniversary Barrel Aged Fest. Lightly hazy brown with a finger thick head. Nothing too unusual, it seems. Oh my, how wrong. Astonishing aroma with oak barrels and balsamic vinegar, as well as a full fruitiness with nice whiffs of sour cherries. Medium body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour with oak and tart fruits, and nice notes of green apples and wild cherries leaving a nice fruity tartness in the finish. Superb sour!

Bottle, bought in SF in August 2013.

Hazy amber with a medium head. The aroma is very nice, Sour with citrus, wood, some cherries and wine. Similar taste. Very refreshing and drinkable, a splendid beer to be honest. Almost like a beer from Cantillon. The finish was dry and with a pleasant tartness. I could have another one.

(6. Aug. 2013, draft from City Beer, SF - 2011 edition) Golden-red and clear, like liquid gold with an orange tint. Nose is sour. Boom. Not any brett really, but a surprising amount of barley or malt at least, without the sweetness though. I got oak, pinot and a hard to define fruitiness. Taste is fantastically sweet and sour, tremendous depth for a sour, the oak barrels punches your whole mouth; sharply on the tip of your tongue - clean, but rich - and more round and woodsy in the back. Almost feels like someone poured in a glob of cherry soda. Beautiful.

Bottle. Inviting nose of wood, cherry, stemmed fruits. Slightly hazy red. Flavor is of dried cherries and a slight woody tannin flavor with a drying sourness. Excellent balance of fruit and sour. 

---Rated via intercellular device

375ml from tleaver33, thanks man. pours light orangy amber, no head. nose of cherries, wine, oak. taste has all these elements plus light tart and sourness. body is light but very acidic. break out the tums.
375ml bottle shared. Pours a dark amber. Funk and sour aroma. A bit of vinegar and grapes on the nose. Smooth without a jolt of tart, yet sour enough to really pucker. Nice and balanced sour.

A: Deep Amber Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head Ring, Almost No Lacing

S: Pinot Noir, Tart Cherries

T: Pinot Noir, Tart Cherries, Tart Red Plum

M: Medicore Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Dry, Somewhat Tart

Overall, this beer really is as advertised, pinot noir and tart cherries galore.

Nice tart aroma with hints of berries. Dirty straw color with short lasting white head. Medium light body with a dry, mouthpuckering mouthfeel. Tart cherry flavor that lasts briefly through the finish. Tasty and refreshing.

Då jag vill kalla mig själv som en passionerad novis kring genren sour/wild ale. Så..tycker jag trots mitt okunnande att det här skriker hantverk, passion och känsla. Syran kittlar svalg och tunga. Rödvinsfat närvarande men pinot noir...och brettanomyces hör enl. vinlagar inte ihop. Men skit samma..touchen av rödvinsfat ger denna genomtänkta bryggd en bra skjuts. Vågar dock inte tänka på vice versa. Alltså pinot noir smaksatt med sour/wild ale. Hur som helt en snuskigt bra upplevelse!

Tap at Hops and Pie. Denver. Poured a murky dark amber with a thin white head. The aroma is citrus acid sour and that pretty much describes the flavour too. The palate has a nice zesty almost sherbet like finish that excites the roof of your mouth and makes this beer a little different and special.

Draft @ Hops&Pie, Denver, Colorado. Pours a hazy amber beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma of oak, sherry, fruits and big vineous characters. Flavour is medium sour, vineous, medium dry and very well balanced. Long, light sour finish. Good brew for sure.

Bottle - Batch 008 - for tonights dreg farming mission. Pours a fairly clean reddish amber with thin white head and soapy lace. Nose of horse blanket, vinegar, lactic acid, citrus, caramel. Medium body, assertive tartness and carbonic bite. Really well balanced sour. Horse blanket, mild vinegar, sour cherry, caramel malt. Havent had one in a couple of years and almost forgot how delicious these are.
Big thanks to tectactoe. Really tart and puckering. A fantastic beer. Really glad I had the chance to try it. Its also got a nice funky back flavor. Very refreshing and drinkable.

Pours a bright amber/copper with a thin white head with lacing.

Cherry is the predominant smell, but also some oak and a touch of tobacco. Also some other lighter fruit smells.

Wow usually dont like sours, but this is unique like nothing Ive ever had. Starts out very champagne like with just a hint of cherry and lots of oak. As it goes down, the cherry flavor brightens significantly and leaves a good pucker by the time its down. 

Fairly light mouthfeel and a very dry champagne like finish with high carbonation.

This beer is amazingly complex and delicious. Finally a sour I could drink every day and it has to be one thats expensive and comes nowhere near the midwest. Ive got another coming in trade and will definitely seek this one out again.

Batch 005x1.
Aroma is fairly fruity with a nice tart cherry character, some medium light oak notes, light acidic character as well. Hint of malt character with some light plum and prune notes.
Pours a fairly murky copper brown with some amber notes. Thin tan head recedes fairly quickly but hints of it linger on the edges.
Medium tart character with a nice lactic character and a hint of acetic acid. Medium cherry fruit note with some plum, prune and hints of raisin. Medium light oak notes. Medium light barnyard character adds some nice complexity. Light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low acidic astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a fairly enjoyable sour cherry beer but I think I like it more when fresh. The fruit is in an odd stage where it is fading but still somewhat assertive; it is in a transition period.

Arguably the best sour I have ever tried. Pours an orange-amber with mild fizz. Aroma is complex, like a fine wine. Sweaty Brett, sour cherries, brown sugar, burnt creme brulee-like sugar, toffee, Pinot Noir. Flavor is Funky tart, oak, SOUR. Faint traces of its "brown ale" roots. But this sour is a man among boys. Worth the price of admission. A true sipper. Amazing.

375 ml bottle from czar - thanks, mate. Pours a sediment-filled orange amber with a short lived white head. Aroma is grapes, cherries, brett funk, wild yeast. Flavor is wild, fruity, sweet, cherry, unripe fruit, white wine. Finish is wild, sour, vinegar, grapes. Medium body, strong carbonation. Everything is right in its place.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange/amber-ish with an off-white head. Aroma is funky, citrus, floral, cherries, bread and some red wine. Taste is funky pungent citrus lemon, sour cherries, bread, and oak red wine. Medium bodied, very balanced refreshing beer. Good carbonation. Awesome Sour!

pours hazy golden orange with a nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. red grape acidity, bretts and overall complex flora, fruitiness and woodsiness - cherries, spices and a bit of wheat, low acetic. bright to average carbonation, light body, grassy-peppery dry bretty and astringent tea finish. excellent!
Det här var en intressant, god och spännande sak, smaken var syrlig med toner av körsbär, druva och jordgubb. Balansen var tjusig och kroppen ytterst passande.
Tack min skapare. Vilket hantverk. Så balanserad och rund för att vara en sour Ale har sällan skådats. Den har fortförande en kraftig syrlighet men ååå vad bra balans. galet bra!

Tap at City Beer, SF. Reddish brown with a few rose coloured bubbles. Lovely sour cherries on the nose, nice kick of dirty lacto tartness, juicy red wine notes. Lovely sugary yet tart cherries in the taste, big vinous kick - full on deep Pinot Noir flavours - good level of dirty yeast funk, light lemon juice twist. Lingering tart cherries and red wine barrel notes. A top top sour.

Bottle. Pours clear amber/brown with a thin white head. Aroma is cherries, funk, sour, wood and bready. Nice sourness, light sweet and light bitter. Very well balanced and great tastes all around. Complex. Lingering finish. Awesome sour. Medium body with soft carbonation.

Poured into a goblet. One finger of head on a deep amber colored body.
The aroma is a sour smell with brown sugar, wood and raspberry all mixed up in the best way.
The taste is quite sour with wood and raspberry. 
The texture is crisper with moderate carbonation.
A great drink.
Bottle, poured an amber red color with aromas of Brett, light funk, sour Cheries, and some light wine. Flavors follow suit, sour cherries with a dry finish, another great beer from these guys.

I poured a 375ml bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 12/17/12 and cost $18 ($1.42 per ounce). Thanks to Dave S. for picking up this bottle for me in Philadelphia.

Appearance: Brown proper color from a distance, though actually ruby red upon closer inspection. Carbonation can be seen streaming up the side. Forms a small, dirty white, soapy head which fizzles away quickly like a soda and leaves no lacing.

Smell: Pungent red wine scent; dark cherries and a general sour aroma.

Taste: Its kind of ironic that beer snobs love sour beers since they tend to taste like liquid candy to me. Thats okay, because a delicious beer is still my idea of a good beer and a reason why Im rating Russian River Supplication so highly. While the craftsmanship that goes into making this beer is quite impressive, its the actual outcome that I appreciate so much.

This beer starts out as a brown ale and is then aged in pinot noir barrels with sour cherries and a cocktail of yeasts and bacteria are added for fermentation and the souring effect. The result is a luscious, complex palette that has so much going on and its all wonderful. To call this beer sour or tart is an understatement. Any beer can be soured, but its pointless without the right base brew. Though the core brown ale is difficult to distinguish, there are still plenty of individual components that are noticeable. Sweet, confectionery flavors of caramel and toffee come through in the finish. The cherries are present from start to finish - initially tart and sharp, but sweeter and more refined at the end. This palette probably wont be enjoyed by everyone, but those who have the taste for it are in for something really special.

Drinkability: Russian River Supplication is about as far from subtle as you can get. That being said, its no challenge whatsoever to drink. The mouthfeel is thin and crisp, but not spastic or obtuse. Its actually really refreshing while in the mouth and leaves just a hint of cherry in the aftertaste. Nothing cloying here at all. It doesnt seem nearly as strong as its 7.75% ABV weight should be. Theres no alcohol presence or excess body here at all.
Just amazing, what a beer! Notes of dried fruits, red wine and cherries in such a balanced way that I think this is top 5 beers I ever tasted.

Pours mahogany with no head. Aroma is cherries, almonds, oak, hints of dates and grapes. Taste is sour cherries, dates, plum, grapes. Extremely well balanced and very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bright amber, thin white head. Soft sweet cherry, wine barrel, bubble gum, sourness. Medium-light, oily body. blanket of fine cotton carbonation. Flavor is cherry cough syrup, booze, tannin, malty wood. Light acetic, wallop of lactic pucker. Too sour to be consumed rapidly or delicious, but a fun sipper. Light earthy leafy hop flavor comes through a second in.

Bottle share at the Syb Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Thanks Derek and Erin! Pours a nice amber haze into a small snifter. Good white foamy head and great lacing. Aroma was brett, fruit, paper, and wine. The taste was complex and well balanced with sour fruit, paper, wine, wood and great brett sourness. I love sours and this one was really really good. Great mouth and bubbly finish with sour after taste.

16 aug 2013, bottle. Dark yellow, clear, no bubbles. Nose is sour. Thin body and moderately fizzy. Dry sour, sour, sour, sweet malt. It's all sour but not puckeringly so. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Source : Library Alehouse Santa Monica.
Appearance : Dark amber with a fast disappearing head.
Aroma : Cherry and Oak.
Taste : Complex sourness and wood.
Palate : Full mouth and effervescent.
Overall : Perfect West Coast Bret beer, I need more !!!!

This beer is, in a word, divine. If you believe sour is at the top of the beer-flavor hierarchy, as I do, than this beer is for you. If you dont believe this, well chances are this beer is still for you. It offers a rich amber color, abundant head, delicious aroma, and even better taste. Aroma is citrus-y, sour, candy-sweet, yet somehow (despite what Ive already said) balanced and distinctly beer-like. Flavor is distinctly sour, although Ive certainly had beers sourer. It has a musty, sweet-tart, clove, complex and delicious. Mouthfeel is excellent.

Perfect balance of sour cherries, vinegar, horse blanket, and barnyard funk. Mouth-puckering sourness is mind blowing, but never overwhelms the other components.

Simply one of the best sours out there

Pours an orangish brown with a loose tan head that goes to a ring. Smell is wood, funk, cherries, must - a lot going on. Taste is tart cherry, earth, wood, raspberry seeds, ending dry and woody. Body is light with snappy carbonation. This beer is a treat.

37.5 cl. Thanks Rian for sharing! Das Bier ist fruchtig-frisch im Geruch, Holz, Kirschen und leichte Säure. Sehr Aromareich. Der Antrunk ist toll vollmundig, leichte Holztöne zusammen mit Kirschsäure, die zum Hauptteil deutlicher wird. Auch im Hauptteil vollmundig, angenehm säuerlich, die 7% Alkohol fast nicht zu schmecken. Intensive Sauerkirschen zusammen mit tollen Holztönen. Dazu ein milder Malzkörper. Hat etwas von einem Flemish Red Ale. 
--> sehr tolles Bier!
13/12/14/14

On tap at russian river brewery. Not much on the nose. Pours a very very dark amber. Perfect sour. Smooth up front with a bitter finish. Again, they just kill the balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, brett, funk, red wine and wood. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium sour with a long sour, dry and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours deep golden with an off white head. Aroma of malt, some cellar notes and sour notes. Flavor is sour and sweet with some malt, caramel and berries. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle of batch 008. Opened with a very loud pop as the cork shot out of the bottle. Pours a reasonably clear brownish ruby amber with a pale head that dissipated quite quickly. Aroma is cherries, raisins, sour plum, red grapes, oak. Somewhat slick mouthfeel, medium bodied, nice balance of sweet and tart on the palate with a rather short finish. Taste is cherries, sour plums, raisins, rosé, grape skins. Lip smacking.

375ml at my place with Thomas, Taylor, And Scott. Pours dark orange. Aroma is medium sour. Taste is sour brown. Finish is medium long and great.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 375 ml bottle shared with a friend. The aroma and flavor is white wine, sour cherries, wild yeast, wood and light fruits. Medium body with a nice sour bite. Very nice.

Rerate:  On tap at Freshcraft.  Light amber, orange-reddish appearnce with a light tan head, mostly dissipating, minimal lacing.  Aroma of sour cherries, dark fruit, red wine, light oak, leather and light herbs.  Similar flavor, sour, mildly sweet and fruity with a crisp, tart finish.  Medium body, average carbonation. 948415, 4.0

Great tart champagne and cherries, strong brett and funk, little notes of brandy. Excellent beer.

Wonderful cherry aroma. Rich amber color. Taste of fruit and Pinot. Very effervescent.

On tap at the brew-pub..Pour is dark red with off white fading head. Smells of cherry, caramel, spices, oak, sweetness, tartness. Taste is light sourness, tart, cherry, oak, dryness, spices, barrel. Decent.

Bottle. 2013 vintage. Tastes of sour cherries. Cherry explosion! One of my all time favorite beers.

5/9/13. YOWZERS!!! Huge sour cherry bomb. Drank it on Shan's bDay night. Shan said it best when she said "It's Dangerous!!"

Batch 010 poured from a bottle into a tulip. Appearance is ruby with a thin white head. Aroma of cherries, red vine and earth. Cherries up front with a tartness that lingers on the finish. One of my favorite red/brown sours.
Aroma is lacking on this, appearance, taste is great cherry flavor, sour palate, overall great

12.68 oz. bottle from the brewery. Batch 062212, Vintage 2012. Brown/ red color with a thin ring of head around the tulip glass. Nose is interesting. Oak, Brett, tart cherry and funky yeast. A light cherry pie filling nuance. Layered complex sour flavors. White wine characteristic from the initial sip. Grape and cherry follow with a tart/ mildly sour oak. Subtle sugar sweetness. Mild mouth-puckering tartness. Sourness lingers for a few seconds and then gone. Very drying texture that takes the moisture from my tongue. The layers of flavor is really impressive in this brew. The wine barrel with the cherries really added amazing flavor to this brew. Really amazing stuff! Did I say I think this is amazing???
tap at brew-pub..Pour is dark red with off white fading head..Nose is cherry, caramel, spices, oak, sweetness, tartness..Taste is light sourness, tart, cherry, oak, dryness, spices, barrel..

Bottle shared with California-dwelling brother-in-law. Cheers Tommy! Pours reddish brown with a small white head. Big fruit and sour aromas, cherry definitely. Taste has big sourness and hints of wood. Very nice, like a good kriek.
Out of bottle. Pours brilliant brown-red. Very champagne like in terms of bubbles. Excellent amazing sour beer,

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 Pours hazy amber with low white head. Aroma of red grapes and berries, sweet cherry, muscovado, some but not much bretta. Taste is big, balanced fruit sour with clear barrel notes. Light, slick body with average carbonation. A brilliant beer, bought two with me, would have bought more if not for fear of overweight charges.

Bottle from the USA cheers Phil; hazy brown pour with a tinge of red small off white head, fruity aroma, first sip is a big sour cherry hit, backed up with apples grapes and some funky farmyard action, there might be horse blanket, but Ive never eaten one of those.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Mega thanks to Chris for this...sour but not too sour, some hints of cherries, mild carbonation (2 years old) smooth, sweet, not cloying and delicious.

Head disappears fast, and carbonation is low ish, aroma is slight sour, but primarily smells of Pinot noir. Some fruity aromas, cherry. Some peppery smells as well. Taste is a vinous sour, slight fruit, pinot very noticeable and maybe a slight peppery taste. Also a slight dryness like Pinot and a very slight bitter finish. Overall very well balanced. None of the flavors or sourness dominates. Awesome!! Only ding is the lack of carbonation. This one NEEDS to be drank at cellar temp~ 50 degrees. The flavors and balance really come out then. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear brown with a tint of pink and thin off white head that quickly disappears. Aromas of funk, with a mild tartness with cherries. Flavors of an ever so mild initial cherry tartness quickly disappearing to some sour funk and followed up with a slight oak finish. As this beer starts to warm, it really opens up. The wine flavors start to become more present along with the sourness mellowing out. I might add, sours are not usually my favorite style.

Pours a clear brown with a thing head but Im suspecting thats the bartenders work because of the sparkly-ness in the glass. Aroma is wine barrels and sour cherries with a nice light well rounded sourness. Taste is sour then sweet and really super good. Seek this out it is worth.

Haven't had a lot of sours, but by God they better be damn good to top this one. Tart, nice cherry notes. Simply incredibly tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

En fût, une version à 7.75%. Cuivrée et limpide, une mousse se résorbant en un mince voile, qui laisse une dentelle éparse au verre. Des arômes très prononcés de levure sauvage, fruités, boisés et de cuir. Un goût des plus suret qui mest arrivé de déguster. Son côté acidulé fait travailler les mâchoires inférieures, le palais et il engourdi la langue. Des élans de vin blanc, par moment et parfois, de limonade. Du zeste de citron et de lime. Ça stimule toutes les papilles gustatives, ça imprègne la bouche bien comme il faut. (678-070613)

Sour complex cherry aroma. Light sweet malt. A little melon. Some mellow oak. Beautiful hazy blood orange and copper color with rustic tones. An ivory/taupe head fades quickly to a collar that almost looks white at the end. Effervescent bubbles throughout. Subtle cherry and malt merry into a complex, rich flavor with full mouthfeel. Sweet malt lingers long on the lips. The sourness is pronounced throughout but beautifully balanced. Wonderful!

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear brown color with a smallish bubbly tan head that disappears almost immediately. Sound is very effervescent, too. Nose has just a hint of sourness coming off of it. Taste is quite sour with some fruit elements to it, but I dont get the cherries (which is good, since I hate them).
Flat pour. No carb left in this one. Aroma is tart cherry, brett, and lemon zest. Taste is red wine, dark fruit, brett, and lemon.

Thanks Farhaad for the trade! Bottle into glad. Beautiful dark amber with a thin bubbly white head that sticks around the edge. Active carbonation. Nose is cherry with a lot of funk and a oak/woody backbone. Taste is tart cherries with bitter cherry skin, great wine/woody flavors weaving in and out and providing a wonderful savory background. Long finish that had notes of more cherry, barnyard, and straw/hay. Good deal of carbonation and bite, but not too aggressive.
Bottle from Larry, Golden orange, thin white head. Aroma of cherries, great vinous notes, lemon tart. Taste is a big pucker lemon/cherry, and vinous finish.
Had this several times. Never disappoints. An awesome American Sour/Wild Ale. Possibly the best one from Russian River?

Bottle from Ales Unlimited in SF.
Pours an amber color on the outside with a foggy reddish brown clouding the middle.  The head dissipates fast.  Another delicious sour from Russian River.  Scent of the pinot and cherries very obvious.  The sourness comes on strong at the end.
Aroma has notes of sour cherry, wood and a touch of red wine.  Taste is fantastic and complex, with notes of sour cherry, lactic sourness, some barnyard funk, red wine, and oak.
Bottle brought to cfobes tasting. Wow, tart cherries and funk to back it up. Ive not tried much from russian river but this is pretty awesome. Ill be liiking for another bottle for sure.
bottle. Red orange with two finger head. Pleasantly tart, and really fruity, especially cherry. Wine comes through really well, but isnt distracting. Amazingly good.

You can smell the cherries, woody, almost cough syrup smell, Ive smelled no beer like it! The color is beautiful off-orange/brownish color and that sour taste is incredible. Im not a huge sour but this one come on! Finally a somewhat hard to find beer lives up to the hype! I apologize to Russian River for saying they were over-hyped, this one is worth it! Has to be one of the best, if not the best sour out there!

Bottle shared by Josh, thanks!  Ive been wanting to try this one for a while so I was pumped to see it randomly show up, pours a dark amber red with an off white head, the aroma is packed full of cherries with an awesome amount of funk and sourness, the flavor has a fruity front end with a dry finish and a good amount of sourness, really nice mouthfeel as well, awesome stuff.

Bottle->snifter.  Hazy orange/amber with bare white head.  Aroma is sour and funky cherries, yeast.  Taste is more of the same, with sour bright funky cherries and yeast. Good carbonation, great lingering tart aftertaste.  Excellent.
Pours deep amber color, reddish hue. Quickly dissipating thin head. Sharp, fruity, smell, no "funk". Carbonated mouthfeel
This is just the bottle to get you into sour beers.  Excellent indeed.  Well balanced and delicious.

Pours clear dark amber with thick white head. Lively carbonation
Aromas of bretta, sour dark cherries, woody from aging in barrells, 
Lovely taste! Lingering touch of bretta, sweetness from cherries and and dry sour finish. The more you sip the better it gets! Masterpiece!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had on draft at Brewery. Pours copper with thin white lacing. Deep, tart, spice nose. Mild sweetness to the taste with a hint of aged grape. Very drinkable and enjoyable.

May 19, 2013 - batch 9 bottle via trade.  Brownish orange pour with limited head that faded quickly.  Sour cherries, brett and wood in the aroma.  Taste was consistent with aroma, but little bit more wood and red wine than brett.

Bottle thanks to Tom. Pours a orange ruby with medium frothy off white head that lasts awhile leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is cherry skin, brett, and wine. Thin mouthfeel with a strong cherry and oak flavor with very nice sour finish. Really enjoyed this one.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 Pours amber, little head, lots of yeast floating. Nose of sour dark fruit, cherries and plum. Sour and plenty of tart cherries. A tad woody on the finish.
Very good sour! Nice aroma, palatable taste thats not overly sour with hints of cherry.

Bottle 2012 vintage - Little funk but nicely soured with the barrels.  Cloudy gold with a thin head.  Nice up front hit of sour and bitterness, crisp and very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderful deep red pour with a thin head. Smells sour with a hint of wine in the aroma. Taste is something to behold. Very different from anything Ive ever had. A must drink for wine lovers. Palate is a bit too sour for my taste but wins points for sheer ingenuity and for the many fantastic flavors. Great beer and worth hunting for!

Clear reddish copper with a small white head that lasts for some time. Aroma is acetic, some green apples, and some slight red fruits touch. Flavor is sour, with some ripe apple, slight lemon and a viney wood note, very good. Medium to light mouthfeel, dry sourness but plenty of favor with a rather gentle aftertaste, refreshing.
Bottle at the Trappist in Oakland.  Sour, a little tart, but otherwise smooth and flavoursome.  Very dark red with a creamy head.  Nice mixture of sour and cherries.  Very palatable and quite deep.

Pours a hazy brown with little to no head.  Aroma of sour fruit and lite oak and funk smells.  Taste is definitely sour but not over the top and cherries with some leather/oak flavors.  Overall it is a great sour and a hard to style to duplicate this quality.

Im new to sours but really enjoyed this. Pours light brown, thin white head that disappeared. Smells tart with a cherry hint to it. Taste is well balanced with the sourness and perfect amount of tart cherry bite. This might be my gateway to sours.

375mL bottle from Belmont Station. 121712 batch.

A:  A darker reddish brown with an inch of foamy off-white head. Leaves moderate stains on the glass. Bright and clear with carbonation running throughout the body.

N: Lots of wine grape, vinegar, grapefruit sourness, sour cherries, and rhubarb. Im getting a whisp of the wood and theres a distinctly cheesy funk (think irish cheddar for the saltiness). Has a sour doughiness and a fair amount of wet leather and peppered earth from the pinot noir.

T:  Moderately sour with a touch of vinegar and acid over the top of a light, fruited sweetness. Theres a touch of salt here which I attribute to the vinegar. Does tend to muddle together a bit. 

M: Very well carbonated and its very assertive on the mouthfeel. Medium-light body with no alcohol presence.

O: I really want to like this one more than I do. Its got a lot going for it, but in the RR pantheon, I prefer Consecration, and in the grander scheme, for fair comparisons, Id probably go with a Rodenbach Grand Cru for about half the price.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy darker, burnt red-orange with a quarter finger of head. Settles quickly with minimal lacing. Aroma is cherry, smells like kriekbier, fruity, vinous, tart, lactic. Flavor is cherry, vinous, oaky, tart finish. Strong cherry but not overpowering or syrupy like many kriek beers, nice oaky balance, delicious. Vinous qualities become much more pronounced as it warms. Moderate to lively carbonation, light body, crisp texture, and dry finish. A very crisp, tart,  refreshing, dry, cherry sour.

Bottle pours a dark amber with a thin, rapidly dissipating off-white head. Aroma is tannic, Pinot grapes, and alcohol. Taste is acerbic, sour cherry, some wine character, and of course Brett. Nice palate, smooth finish for a sour.

375ml bottle, Batch 008, at Monks in Philly. Pours slightly hazy reddish amber with a reddish white head.  Smell is sour/tart cherries, wood, oak, tannin and lots of funk.  Taste is cherries, citrus fruits, pinot tannins, oak and funkiness. The taste is tart but incredibly smooth. The finish is absolutely beautiful. The beer is funky, but not overly so, its extremely delicate and balanced. Perfect carbonation, perfect balance. An amazing beer.
Amazing sour.. nice tingle as soon as it  hits ur tounge. Sour finish.. not to much fruit hits behind it.. I like this type of sour.
Possibly the best beer Ive ever had. A very tart beer, vinegary, acidic, and funky. You can definitely taste the influence of the pinot noir as well. Wow, if only I had more than one!

Poured into a flute. 

Pours dark amber with nice creamy head. 

Aroma is of funk and cherries. The taste was more funk, cherries, vinegar. Quite sour, very refreshing!

A very well crafted beer, well worth the 1.5 hour drive to acquire. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Russian River. Reddish brown with a small white head. Aromas of sour cherry and grapes. Balanced sour cherry flavors.

Smells, amazingly, like sour cherries and Pinot noir. I mean, this stuff smells exactly like Pinot! Its translucent, with a blood orange/deep ruby color. The flavor is out of this world. Its tart, with tons of sour cherry flavor, but the delicate Pinot noir notes keep it from going nuts. It leaves you with a sour cherry candy taste in your mouth that hangs around for just long enough to bring you back for more. This is a tremendous beer.

Pours a ruby brown with a small head. The aroma is primarily cab grapes and wood with the biscuity dough of an abbey dubbel coming through on the end.  The palate is so beautiful. Complex and sweet with a wonderful tannic dryness on the finish. Beautiful.
